annotation.TEXT: YES!!!
And that's the end! What a nice picture. However, before I end this video, there's one more thing I've gotta check...
And now, fireworks.
Fortunately, the flames aren't invisible, so once again, there's nothing special about the flame-dodging rounds.

Also, the other challenge suggestions I got were just play with one hand if I'm using a controller, or play with 2x or 3x emulator speed if I'm playing with the keyboard. I use the keyboard, but ZSNES's "2x" is way more than 2x for some reason (I think it's actually like 16x in reality!), so sorry, but that's not happening.
Space-time rewind count: 4
Ah, and we've got bullets, but as long as they're not evil homing bullets, I should be fine.
And, seventh is down, and keep holding down, because you've gotta enter a pipe coming up here!

Yeah, it produces a vine that you will need to grab. However, the vine doesn't scroll with the elevator, because it was created on layer 1, and the downward scrolling stuff is on layer 2 (I think). So, you wouldn't want the vine to be too high to reach!
Oh, of course I'm going to duck under at least one of them! (I felt like I was a little out of position to attempt that on the first one.)
Ha! I suspected that that saw would fall to the right there.
Okay, I stomped both of these Mechakoopas in one jump, so I may attack Bowser with them now.
You're welcome!
I could probably accomplish 1â™¥P combos there fairly easily, but now's not the time for fooling around!
Anything that falls into the grape soda below is considered dead and will never respawn, including the saws.
Actually, no. Our adventure is not over yet! Luica still gets her turn!
How many exits have I gotten?
Oh, you know what? If I stand in between the Mechakoopas when they land, I think getting the 2-stomp combo will be easier!
So, where's Bowser? Oh, he's there, but as you probably noticed just before I entered the boss door, I turned off layer 1. This makes Bowser and his clown car invisible.

The restriction will be as follows: I must stomp both Mechakoopas with one jump in order to attack Bowser with them. If I fail to do so, I must get rid of those Mechakoopas and wait for the next pair to appear.
Bah. I thought I had more headroom than that.
Zwee!
Alright, I've finished round two. But... Oh, man. Round three is probably gonna be a thing.

Now, so far, this 2-stomp combo challenge hasn't seemed all that challenging, but I'm betting the final round will change that! Can I effectively pull off 2-stomp combos while Bowser's bouncing around like a maniac? Let's find out...
Ah, but I do get clues as to his location, such as when he does his Mechakoopa tossing.
Yeah, that was a tiny usage of the left+right glitch there, just to save myself a second of slow travel.
Okay, now I have to dodge the bowling balls, and I don't think I'm going to try ducking under them this time, since I'd want to know exactly where Bowser is dropping them to attempt that.
Hello, and welcome to the finale of Super Marina World! Now, let's take a look at the votes to see just how I'm going to be playing these final two levels...
And now for round two, the bowling ball round.
Okay, now this is based off of one of the rooms of the fourth castle, Burning Castle.
Hi, Yoshi!
The fifth room is based off of a theme from the fifth castle, Hot Air Castle.
Man, even with the clues, I'm having trouble hitting him...

Cool. Now, I've got a leftover Mechakoopa that was involved in a 2-stomp combo, so I could technically save it for the final round. However... I'm actually going to destroy it right now, just to be more sporting to Bowser.
Eastmost penninsula is the secret.
Aha, the upper spikes there were of the loose variety, so I can get through now and reach midpoint! See ya, cloud!
Second is down...
Nuts. I wanted a cape. Oh, well. This is still better than nothing.
Oh, I remember this part from raocow's video. You need to use an ice block to hit the turn block on the left. But, wait for the turn block to drop down a bit before doing so.
Wheeee!!! No need for the left+right glitch here! Just stay in the air current to dodge everything!

Yep, remember that high-speed autoscrolling segment from Water Castle? This is the same idea, but there are no coins to guide you this time, so you've gotta remember that wind code on the wall from the previous room! First is up...
And those green switch blocks are the reason why. If you forgot about them and took the bottom path, better luck next life.

If I miss with an attack, but that Mechakoopa stays alive and in bounds, like in that case, I can continue to try attacking with it. If I somehow lose a Mechakoopa though, I'll have to wait for the next Mechakoopa pair and 2-stomp combo them to try again.
Here's the list of the custom music that was used during this hack, which is pretty cool.
Yay! I won the race! If you lose the race, you can't enter the door, and will have to suicide.
Make sure you're paying attention for loose ceiling spikes!

Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through Super Marina World! However, I'm not quite done with making videos of this hack, yet! What will I do for the next video? Find out next time! To be continued...
Well, that didn't work as intended, and now that shell's been grape sodified (is that even a word?). Alright, I'm going to take a big risk here...
Well, that was a short level, and those star coins were rather easy to find. Okay, now before I enter the boss door, I'm going to make one little adjustment here...
Or, you could just quickly stomp that other shell like I did there. Whatever. Time for the fourth room!
Fourth is up...
Well, someone voted for a random quote after beating Bowser... Alright, so Marina has rescued Prince Pine!
Sixth is up...
Okay, got my 2-stomp combo, and then Bowser stomped one of them, which I expected to happen, but I can still strike him with the other one!
D'oh, I didn't mean to tear through that many blocks there.
Very important: Remember the exact paths you're taking as you go to the left here!
Huh. No music, and this room seems suspiciously similar to the original SMW's spotlight room. However, it's not exactly the same.
Oh, sure. Now I'm given a cape. Well, I'll still take it! (Yes, the cape turned invisible there when I made the shell appear, but it never actually despawned. Silly graphics glitch.)
Okay, no problems there. Now, can I aim the Mechakoopas properly?
Third is down...
Bam! 2-stomp combo! Attack!
Whoa. The prince is disembodied! Still, he provides me with a mushroom like usual, which I can certainly use.
Alright, got him that time! End of round one! Oh, and unlike with Marina's turn, I am actually going to hang onto the leftover Mechakoopa for use at the beginning of the next round.
Oh, I see what this is doing immediately. It's going to cover the themes of the first seven castles. First, we have Castle of Vines (the first castle).
Aww, how sweet.
BGM: Super Mario Bros. Metal Version

By the way, what I did earlier just before I entered the boss door was use a hex editor to change the bytes relevant to the Bowser battle music to 00, which removed the music. This way, I could keep the sound effects when I edited in the special music with WMM.
I wonder why 2 player mode needed to be disabled, though. I mean, this certainly could've been okay as a standard 2 player hack, right?
Okay, can I aim the right way this time?
So, Luica's challenge is to defeat Bowser in this state. Thanks go to UltraLeet31337 for suggesting this challenge.
Alright, now for a theme from the seventh castle, Rising Castle. It's an eating block race segment!
Yes, I just tried to duck and squeeze through that narrow gap, but it didn't quite work, so I'll just climb down below like a normal person.
BGM: Touhou 14 - Sukuna's Theme - Kobito of the Shining Needle ~ Little Princess
Whoa. Almost got carelessly Thwomped there. Now, for the last split... Well, we initially took the bottom path there upon first entering this room, but we want to take the middle path now.
Ah, this one's based off of the theme of the third castle, Green Castle.
Yes, I remembered to turn layer 1 back on at this point. (I actually left it off during the credits, but I don't think layer 1 was used during the credits, surprisingly.)
I think this would've been a great place for Yoshi's Island: SMW2 - Room Before Boss music.
The spiky corridor gets kind of narrow here. Too narrow at one point actually, but...
Proper usage of shells can help you get rid of saws around here.
The elevator stops well before the moving block can reach the door, but fear not! There's a hidden coin block under the door that you can use!
...Huh? Where's the second bowling ball? That's weird. Bowser only dropped one bowling ball that time for some reason.
Is it possible to have this message change based on which player is currently active?
Farfignewton! I did not see that Podoboo coming!
D'oh! I got him once, but I was hoping to get a quick victory there. Argh, this isn't good!
Same deal as before with these currents. Just don't enter them from the obviously stupid side. Also, I'm going to try to avoid using the left+right glitch here.
Spotlight! Now, this room may differ from the original SMW's, but it's still got most of the same things, including Ninjis and Mechakoopas.
Alright, you guys heard... er, read the votes. I'm starting things off with Marina in 8-5, which is basically the Front Door!

By the way, the other music suggestions I got included a U. N. Owen was her? remix, the Final Countdown theme, Super Mario Galaxy 2's Final Bowser theme, Mega Man 8-Bit Deathmatch's Final Boss theme, and Beloved Tomboyish Girl. Thanks for those suggestions!
Oh, there's that same message that was at the end of 9-8. Oh, but the bottom line has been changed from "What a fragile..." to "How fragile...".
It says "A", so you gotta "A"! (If you don't want to get hurt, that is!)
Okay, so they go: Up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right, B, A... No, wait, that's something entirely different. The currents actually go: Up, down, down, up, down, up, down. Remember that.

Quickly, reveal the blocks here and climb up. You can probably get away with not revealing all of them, but if you screw up with that, you'll probably waste more time than if you revealed them all in the first place.
Okay, I scored one hit, but now I have to dodge two more bowling balls...
BGM: Fortune Street - Final Boss
And that's game!
Also, I'm not showing the music and challenge suggestions for the Bowser fights here. I'll mention those later.
Okay, can I get past round three?
Thanks go to UltraLeet31337 for suggesting this music.
I came up with this little challenge idea myself, as I only got a few challenge ideas, and I only really liked one of them (and Luica will be doing that challenge later).
And, let's watch the credits roll. (Also, I held the up direction during the transition to the credits to get Luica to walk funny.)
And now we get a look at most of the dooders that played for the antagonist's team.
That is one tricky-looking star coin to get. It'd be much easier with a cape, but I don't have a cape right now. Maybe I could go back and get a shell to remove that upper block with...
Uh, oh! Suddenly, autoscrolling!
Fifth is down...
And here's some other patches. I love the overworld speed changer for letting me get from point A to point B in a flash!
Luckily, I nailed that perfectly!
Watch out for the Mechakoopa that tries to ambush you from above here.
Alright, that adjustment has been made! Okay, Luica... Are you ready? Let's enter the door... for final boss time!
Nuts. I wasted my free shot.
For the second split, take the bottom path.
Pfft... Yeah, I got the combo, but then that happened. Okay, let's try that one more time...
Okay, there they are. Now, I don't have to stomp combo them or anything like that this time. I just have to deal with Bowser's invisibility.
Thanks go to KarisaMirisame for suggesting this music.
Oh, who's that? Was that Prince Pine that we heard about much earlier?
I hope you remembered which way you came from, because you're doomed if you pick the wrong path now! The correct path for this first one is the upper path.
Well, there's some lava, but it's not a threat to your well-being at all.
Oh, man. This next part is based off of a certain part of the sixth castle, Water Castle. See these tiny blocks of wind here? Remember their positions. This is very important.
BGM: Final Fantasy Mystic Quest - Doom Castle
Resist the urge to jump into the anti-freeze, and kick the shell to the right so that it repeatedly toggles the ON/OFF block for you.
Gee, I wonder if we'll be hitting an ON/OFF block and then making use of that P-switch in a moment...
Now here, you don't actually need a shell, but if you use one to kill this other shell as soon as the path is opened up, you'll have a much smaller pit to jump over.
And of course, you kind of need a shell to get past some of these barriers. Hopefully, you didn't stupidly kill them all beforehand!
Sorry, I don't think I really have much to say right now. However, I didn't want to fast-forward through any of the ending this time.
Argh! Once again, I jumped too high. I think the greatest danger when fighting invisible Bowser like this is the invisible propeller.
Conglaturation !!! You have completed a great game. And prooved the justice of our culture. Now go and rest our heroes !
And now this room is done! Now for the third room...
It looks like one hundred! I guess this means I've gotten every exit, right?
That was a tight fit right there.
This has been a pretty great hack, honestly. I definitely enjoyed it.
Of course, there's not much in the way of burning stuff here. Instead, it's the elevator theme that's focused on here.
Cool. I landed one blow already.
Alright, where is the guy? I kind of have to guess where he is and hope I'm right.
And now for the flame-dodging phase. It's the same as always. Nothing special to do here besides not getting hit.
Okay, where are those Mechakoopas...?
We get started with a couple of free power ups that I don't need right now. (Also, it's interesting how the timer started at exactly 777.)
What, "Marina"? No way! That's so wrong! Luica's the winner here!
I hope you don't mind if I turbo spin my cape while I'm waiting around.
And, now I'm shelling myself like a moron. Swell.
Note: I received one additional vote for 8-D (I'm assuming that means 8-D first) after I had already made this video. However, it wouldn't have affected the outcome here.
Okay, the second room appears to be based off of the theme of the second castle, Castle of Loop.
(Only "most"? Well, custom sprites aren't going to appear here obviously, and Magikoopa missed the photoshoot, unfortunately.)
Huh? Normal outdoors music? What's going on?
And here comes Bowser! Now, just to make things slightly more interesting, I'm going to impose a little handicap here...
Don't waste time trying to get all of the coins here, but certainly go for the star coin on the right if you've been collecting them.
Okay, Luica... This might be your last chance... But, you can totally win this!
Well, that was certainly challenging! Hey, didn't the original Kaizo Mario World end with an invisible Bowser fight just like this?
Alright, I'm all set. Are you? Let's enter the door, for final boss time!
There's the last star coin, and there's the boss door. Now, I'm going to take a quick pause break while I adjust something really quick...
...Or throw one of them out of bounds by accident, LOL! I can still attack with the other one, but I'm going to have to wait for another Mechakoopa pair before I can finish this round.
Alright, now Luica is going to infiltrate the back door, titled "Careless Bowser"!
